Fields.DialogueText: Achilles, may I speak with you for a moment?
Of course, Captain. How can I help?
I received a communication from the captain of the Ajax. I'm told that you've been goading your sister into a shooting competition?
Can you believe her gall? She's been spreading rumors that she's a better shot than I am!
Achilles... you realize she's not a Belle, right?
That hasn't stopped her from throwing down her gauntlet!
Settle down, Achilles.
I'm perfectly settled, Captain. It's easy to know your place when you know you'll be victorious!

Fields.MenuText: Well, now. That's a bit arrogant, isn't it?
Good to see a healthy bit of ego, there.
Have you ever read the story of David and Goliath?

Fields.DialogueText: Arrogant or not, truth is truth, Captain.
And I've got more to spare!
Of course! Little David reminds me of myself!
I can see we're going to have some interesting times together. You're dismissed while I ponder this.
@BATTLE
"May you live in interesting times." For you, a sincere wish. For today's Morganas, a curse.
Achilles, I've spoken with the captain of the Ajax.
Why? I've already told you Ajax can't talk to her captain.
Exactly. So how is it you can?
How do you breathe, Captain?
Be specific, Captain. How do your lungs work? What happens to the air once it's in there? How does it work?

Fields.MenuText: Okay, point taken.
You're not going to distract me from my question.
You're saying it's something you can't control?

Fields.DialogueText: So you believe me now?
And you're not going to ever understand.
No, I'm saying it's something I can just do, period.
That's not the point. The point is that if you can understand Ajax, perhaps you can help us communicate with her and other ships in the navies to help...
Morganas sighted, port bow!
We'll pick this up later, Achilles.
@BATTLE
If we must.
Can we talk more about this ability of yours?
I thought we covered this already.
Oh, we have. I'm not going to ask you about how you do it.
Thank you.
I'll just ask if you will do it.
Excuse me?

Fields.MenuText: Was I unclear? Will you talk to the other ships for me?
It's just that, well, it would really help if you could talk to ships for us.
I know you heard me. Do I need to make it an order?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I understood you. I just don't understand what it is you want.
What would help would be if you dropped this whole thing.
As with every sailor, I follow every legal order.
I'm not really sure I like your tone there.
This isn't something worth drawing your sword over, Captain. it's just something that is. Water is wet. The sun is bright. I can understand my sister Ajax. Accept that.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
And Belles must strike Morganas down. Another truth, Captain. Don't belabor it.
Captain, a moment of your time?
Hmm? What is it, Achilles?
I heard you put out a call to see if there were any other Belles who were willing to talk about how they communicated with their sisters.
I did... I haven't had any responses.
That's not surprising. The truth is, Captain, even if you were to find a Belle willing to exploit the ability, there wouldn't be much to gain from it.
Why's that?
The non-Belle ships... their knowledge is limited. I mean, they're asleep, you know? I don't think you would find their help very... helpful.
Is this just your way of convincing me that you're smarter than your sister?
No! Although, I've no doubt that were she awake, I would be smarter than her..

Fields.MenuText: Must be nice to be so smart, eh?
Things look good from that high horse, do they?
What would the rest of us do without your vast knowledge, Achilles?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, it is, and thank you for noticing.
I do my best work on foot. But the view is well earned.
Wait, we're talking about people now?
Sarcasm, Achilles - sarcasm. We're going to have to teach you about sarcasm.
Or we could speak plainly. I like that more. Let's do that.
@BATTLE
On the subject of what you do best...
Of course, Captain. One day my opponents may even be worthy.
Achilles, about talking to other ships-
No.
I... wait, what? What do you mean, no?
I mean no. I'm not talking about that anymore. I only brought it up to complain about Ajax, not to get into anything beyond that.
But this is important.
No, it's really not. We Belles are enough to combat the Morganas... so there's no need to dwell on it. This is the last thing I'm saying about it, period.
I could order you to talk about it, you know.
You wouldn't refuse a direct order, would you?
Curiosity will be the death of you, even if it does not act through me.

Fields.MenuText: I appreciate the loyalty, though I can't say I like the delivery.
All right, all right, message received.
This stinks, you know that?

Fields.DialogueText: A sword is a sword, Captain. Pretending otherwise is just dangerous.
Thank you, Captain. I appreciate your understanding.
I don't smell anything, but I'll take your word for that.
Let us consider this closed, then.
As long as we can pick up the idea of a shooting contest again, I'm game.
All right, we'll talk about that later. Right now I need to fill out some resupply forms. I'll get back to you soon.
@BATTLE
You'll leave my side when this battle is done and no later.
Let's talk about this shooting contest idea of yours.
It's quite simple, really. I know I can shoot better than Ajax, and I can prove it.
In a controlled setting, I'm sure you could, but is that really a challenge?
I wouldn't think so, no.
So we'll just have to find something that is.
Do you think something like that exists?

Fields.MenuText: One day, Achilles, that ego will get you into trouble.
You know what I like about you? Your sense of the awesome.
We mere mortals will do our best, Achilles.

Fields.DialogueText: I look forward to that challenge!
It is pretty keen, isn't it?
It won't be enough, but we'll survive.
Morganas sighted, port bow!
Saved by the gong. We'll pick this back up afterwards.
@BATTLE
So we're agreed that a simple shooting contest isn't enough, yes?
Not nearly! That Ajax shot off her mouth, and she won't get off that easy!
Simmer, Achilles, simmer. Thing is, I've gamed this out a few different ways and have a few concerns for you to think about.
Example.
Ha, ha. You want this to be a fair fight, so to speak, so that any victory will be uncontested.
Naturally.
And you want the fleet's Belles and... other ships... to know of it, right?
Bullseye, Captain.
Here's what I'm thinking: you'll want to have three to five different contests spread out over a series of days. That way you can account for things like inclement weather and such.
Sounds complex.

Fields.MenuText: Not for someone of my brilliance.
It won't be chicken feed, but I'm sure I can get it done.
Why do I have the feeling I'll be handling this?

Fields.DialogueText: All right, thanks for volunteering.
Good to see you getting in the spirit.
Well, if you insist.
Fine, I'll handle the details. Do you have a preference for...
Morganas sighted, moving fast!
Sound general quarters!
@BATTLE
I'll do my job, Captain. See that you do yours.
Any word about the contest rules yet, Captain?
This isn't my only issue, you know. I have requisition forms, personnel forms to update, casualty and performance reports to review and approve...
All right, all right, stop boring me with the tedious parts. Just let me know when my stuff is ready, will you?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I wouldn't dream of making you wait too long.
I'll get to it when I get to it, Achilles.
You know, you could pitch in a bit more around here.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm guessing this is some of your prized sarcasm?
Just don't make me wait too long, Captain.
I think I do enough, thank you.
Yes, well... I'll let you know as soon as I can.
@BATTLE
The sooner the better! I'm ready to go down in history as the best.
As long as you don't go down in history as a Morgana casualty.
*ALARM*
C'mon, Achilles. Let's get you some shooting practice.
Achilles, I have something here for you.
Oh, goody! Is it my contest rules?
Oh, goody? Yes, it's the contest rules.
Let me see, let me see! Okay, yes, uh huh... wait, what?
I wondered how long it would take you to get there.
"Only the first twenty shots per engagement shall be counted"?! How is that supposed to show off my abilities?

Fields.MenuText: It's called fairness, Achilles. Nothing more, nothing less.
By hitting more times than Ajax does?
You're not giving this the proper thought, Achilles. It...

Fields.DialogueText: Fairness meant to help the other side?
Which I can, and I will, but still... only twenty?
Stinks! That's the word you were going to use, right? It stinks!
The point is simple, and if you'd give yourself a chance to think about it, you'd understand...
Morganas spotted!
You'll have to clarify later, Captain. To battle!
@BATTLE
So about this shot limit... have you realized the foolishness of it yet?
Have you realized the foolishness of wanting unlimited shots?
The more I shoot, the more I hit, so why would I want to limit my shots?
And what if you have fewer targets to shoot at that day than Ajax does?
I... well...
And if you're affected by rain or turbulent seas? No extra points for hitting in bad weather... but a miss is a miss.
You're assuming I'll miss at all.
Admit it. You didn't think it through. It's okay, just say the words.
I'm not sure that's quite the point, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, but it is, Achilles.
Oh? You have another point for me to find, then?
Stubborn as always, Achilles. Be sure it's not your downfall.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn your reasoning, Captain!
Yes, at the tip of my spear!
My downfall? MY downfall? Do you even know what you're talking about?
It's okay, Achilles. I won't make you admit you're wrong. I'll just tuck that knowledge safely away in my mind and savor it from time to time. Now, about the contest itself....
Morganas sighted, dead ahead!
I'll take my anger out on them. You too will be thankful for the war.
@BATTLE
I believe we were discussing the upcoming contest.
Only after you apologize.
For what, exactly?
For making me feel like a fool.
Achilles, it isn't my job to superintend your feelings. It's yours. If you feel like a fool because I pointed out your lack of forethought...
Stop tossing out those big words and say what you mean!

Fields.MenuText: What big words? Forethought?
Stop lashing out!
You're avoiding the true issue, but I still forgive you.

Fields.DialogueText: That, and... and... superintend... and... forethought!
I'm not lashing out. You're lashing out!
Wait, I'm the one who's supposed to receive an apology!
No, it's clear to me that you're acting out of anger over being shown your mistake. Perhaps you aren't ready for something as serious as a shooting contest after all.
Wait, Captain. Very well... I apologize for my manner.
Thank you.
Now will you...
Yes, yes, I'll arrange the contest. Just let me get in touch with Ajax's captain.
Hooray!
Morganas, Captain, dead ahead!
@BATTLE
You've defused my anger, but I'll try and channel what's left.
Achilles, there seems to be a problem.
What, did Ajax back out?
No, not at all. In fact, quite the opposite.
What's the opposite of Ajax backing out? Ajax plowing in?
Other ship captains have radioed me, asking to join in the, and I quote, "fun."
WHAT?
Seems word of your little contest has gotten around the fleet. Apparently you have some competition for the title of best shot.
I... what are we going to do?

Fields.MenuText: What, afraid of a little competition?
I can't believe you're suddenly backing down.
Come on, I know you. The more the merrier, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Me, afraid? No, never!
I'm not backing down, not by a long shot!
Yeah, that's right, bring them on!
That's more like it. I'll have to take another swat at the rules to include more ships, but the basics should remain the same.
Those with the most hits win?
Those with the most hits out of the first twenty, yes.
Can't blame a girl for trying, can you?
@BATTLE
Think that's why the Morganas attack us?
Hah. We fight because there is something to destroy; the Morganas, because they have to destroy something.
All right, Achilles, I've finally got the roster down. Here, take a look.
That is... quite the roster.
Yes, word got out quickly. I fear that if we wait too long, someone higher up the chain of command is going to get wind of this and try to shut it down.
Why would they do that?
Come now, Achilles. When have they ever let us have any unscheduled fun?
Point taken, Captain. Okay, so when do we get started?
I've set up a system with the other captains. We all get together for a radio call at 0800 hours. Each of the captains has set up a series of ping-pong balls in a bag.
This sounds complex.
I don't want anyone to accuse me of slanting things towards my Belle now, do I? Anyway, the balls are numbered. Each day I have five captains draw a ball and read off the numbers.
And?
And if the sum of the numbers ends in a zero or a five, that day counts as a contest day for anyone engaging in combat. Simple.
So roughly one out of every five days will be a contest day?

Fields.MenuText: That about sums it up.
Easy enough to understand, right?
I know. It stretches things out more than you'd like, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, I'm ready. Let's go get your balls.
Simple enough even for Ajax to understand, ha!
Of course, but you're right - it can't look like we're favoring me in any way.
Okay then. There will be five total contest days, so make every shot count between now and the end. Practice, practice, practice!
Yes, Captain! Right away.
@BATTLE
Well, what were the numbers today?
The sum was twenty-three, sorry.
Grr, that's three days in a row!
Patience, Achilles. Keep your mind at ease so you have the best chance of winning.
I don't fight best with my mind at ease, Captain. I fight my best when my blood's running hot.

Fields.MenuText: Does your blood run?
Hmm, interesting. I never knew that about you.
You're a warrior born for these times, Achilles, have no doubt.

Fields.DialogueText: You of all people should know better than to lecture me on figures of speech!
Well, I'm glad you're starting to pay attention.
I am, and I don't, and thank you in that order.
Morganas sighted, port bow!
Excellent, now I have a chance to take out my frustration. To arms!
@BATTLE
Get ready, Achilles - today's the day.
We got the numbers? YES!
Ha ha, I will crush Ajax... er, I mean the competition!

Fields.MenuText: Just remember who the real enemy is, Achilles.
Keep it in check, Achilles.
Better hope we have something to shoot at today, then.

Fields.DialogueText: Have no fear. I can't forget.
My shots will fly true, Captain!
The universe wouldn't be that cruel, would it?
Oh, and one more thing to remember. I'd hate to lose the--
Morganas sighted to starboard!
Wait, what spoils? What would you hate to lose?
Later, Achilles! For now, get out there and make those shots count!
Aye, Captain! Don't think this is over!
@BATTLE
So, about these spoils....
Don't get cocky, Achilles. Just because you won the first day doesn't mean you'll win the entire thing.
I had the highest score in the shortest time. I don't think I'll have any problems.
You'd better not. If you do, we lose our next holiday's rations.
WHAT?
I told you - to the victor go the spoils. Every captain thinks their ship is the best. It's easy to say that when you've got nothing backing your words.
So you bet our special meals on my abilities?

Fields.MenuText: Well, Achilles, are you the best or aren't you?
Just think how disappointed the crew will be if you don't win.
I only made the bet because I was sure you could do this.

Fields.DialogueText: You've put your faith in the right place, Captain. I won't let you down!
Oh, thanks for that kind of pressure!
Thank you, Captain. I won't let you down.
I'm sure you wouldn't say no to some extra practice, though, would you?
Certainly not.
Good, because that looks like trouble brewing off our...
Morganas dead ahead!
To victory!
@BATTLE
Come on, Achilles, we're up!
Another contest day?
Day two, and we've got Morganas closing in on us fast.
I don't like the look of this weather.
Me neither, so make every shot count!
@BATTLE
Well, that could have gone better.

Fields.MenuText: Indeed, but it also could have gone worse. Good job keeping your head out there.
You did the best with what you had. Don't beat yourself up.
The weather was a factor, but in the end, it's on your shoulders.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. I only wish we could have done better.
I won't, but I still regret my low totals.
I agree. No excuses. Today's low tally is my responsibility alone.
We'll get them next time. We're still within spitting distance of first place.
And next time I'll be sure to put us over the top. Excuse me, Captain. I need to think for a while.
Of course. You're dismissed.
Achilles, get your gear together and get a move on!
Another contest day?
Day three of five. Are you ready?
Of course... I think...

Fields.MenuText: Don't overthink this, Achilles. Just go out and do your level best.
I believe in you, Achilles. Let's go kick some Morgana stern!
Don't think of the past mistakes, Achilles. Let them go.

Fields.DialogueText: I will, Captain... do my level best, that is.
Aye... aye Captain!
Low key as always, Captain, but well spoken nonetheless.
@BATTLE
So what are the standings like?
After three contest days, Ajax is ahead of us by three shots.
That rascal! She has to be cheating somehow!

Fields.MenuText: Come now, Achilles, let's not be sore.
It isn't over until it's over, Achilles!
What happened to the glorious warrior I once knew? Where did she go?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sore... not entirely...
You're right. We'll get this one yet... I mean, I hope we will...
She's still here, just wounded...
You've got to shake this off, Achilles! You're the best shot in this entire navy! You know it, I know it, everyone knows it! All you have to do is go out there and be yourself.
But what if being myself isn't enough? I've always known I was the best. If Ajax beats me... will I still be me? Will I still be the ultimate warrior?
Of course you will. In fact, you'll be better for the experience.
You think so?
I know so.
Morganas inbound! We've got two minutes!
Come on, let's go get that confidence back by blasting some Morganas.
Aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
Day four, Captain?
Day four, Achilles.
What do you think today will bring us?
More destruction than despair, I hope.
You're awfully maudlin, suddenly; anything I can do to help?
You can tell me where you learned that word, for starters.
What, maudlin? What's wrong with that?
This from the woman who was angry at me so recently for using the words "superintend" and "forethought" in a sentence.
Captain, is there something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing I can't handle on my own, Achilles. This is my fight.
Yes, but believe me, you're the last person who can help me.
Nothing I want to talk about... not with you, that is.

Fields.DialogueText: All right, then, I can respect that. Just let me know if you need my shield by your side.
If not me, then whom?
Well, that's just downright awful, Captain. If you can't discuss it with your right hand woman...
Morganas sighted, port bow!
Ah, perfect. Come on, Achilles, let's go score you some points!
Hmm... the Captain suddenly perked up. I wonder what's gotten into... no, not now. Right now, I've got a contest to win!
@BATTLE
Are those the new tallies, Captain?
Why, yes. They are.
Am I going to like them?
Yes and no. What do you want first - the good news or the bad news?
Err... the bad news.
Ajax is still in the lead.
There's good news after that?
You're only behind by one shot! You're absolutely in this, Achilles.
Morganas sighted, port bow!
Captain, about earlier...

Fields.MenuText: I still don't want to talk about it.
It's not your business, Achilles.
Thank you for your concern, Achilles, but I'm just not ready to discuss it.

Fields.DialogueText: I... as you say, Captain.
You are my business...
Just remember I'm here when you're ready.
I'll keep that in mind. In the meantime, let's go crush us some Morganas.
@BATTLE
This is it, Achilles. Today's the day!
What, today? Are you sure?
I can add, Achilles, so yes, I'm sure. What's gotten into you?
Truthfully, Captain... I don't like the weather.
This again?
I lost last time the weather was bad, and now it's even worse than last time. What if it...

Fields.MenuText: Snap out of it, Achilles! The warrior I've come to respect isn't afraid of weather!
Snap out of it, Achilles! You're weaker than an overcooked noodle!
Snap out of it, Achilles! The time for fear is past, the time for action is now!

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Captain. Your warrior stands ready to fight and to win!
Your words shame me into fighting form. I am ready.
Action, action... you want action? I'll rip their heads off and eat them whole!
That's the spirit. Besides, the weather can shift in a heartbeat.
Morganas sighted, port bow!
Go, Achilles, get to work! Remember, no one's better at this than you are!
@BATTLE
Do you have the results yet, Captain?
No, Ajax still hasn't reported in. Can you... er... can you ask her what her numbers were?
Captain, I told you we wouldn't speak of this again and I meant it.
I understand, Achilles. It's just that I know how much this contest means to you, and I want it to be over and done with.
Afraid of the result?

Fields.MenuText: Quite the opposite. I'm so confident, I can practically taste my holiday dinner!
Not afraid so much as nervous, like a child on Christmas day.
A bit, honestly. Your shooting was terrific, but that second day really put us back.

Fields.DialogueText: And I look forward to your joy in eating it.
I wouldn't know. I've never celebrated Christmas.
I thought we were past that, Captain!
Well, look, this is...
Morganas on the move!
Ajax's numbers will just have to wait. Let's get to it.
@BATTLE
Achilles? Achilles?
Captain?
We finally heard from Ajax. She had...
... part of her radio shot off, I know.
Yet you kept bugging me for the numbers? No, never mind... are you ready for the results?
As ready as I'll ever be. Hit me!

Fields.MenuText: It was a tight race... but you won!
You got lucky, Achilles, but you won.
Ajax choked at the last minute and gave you the victory.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew it! I am the greatest warrior to ever live!
Victory is mine!
I expected those words from her, not you, but I accept the victory regardless.
Morganas inbound!
What better way to celebrate than this?
None. To battle!
@BATTLE
Do you remember earlier, when I said I didn't want to talk about a certain subject?
Of course. You were very mysterious. It was...
Annoying?
I was going to say oddly compelling.
Well, I've had some time to process, and I'd like to talk to you about it now. I've been thinking about how much fun I've had with you recently, and...
Yes?

Fields.MenuText: I just wanted you to know that I haven't had that much fun in a long, long time.
I realized what I was enjoying was being with you.

Fields.DialogueText: Victory is joyful, but it's more than that. I've enjoyed our time together as well, Captain.
Well... I really enjoyed spending time with you as well, Captain.
